title: Kinetic energy graph of an oscillating block

content.question: A mass on a spring of spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> oscillates as shown. Which of the following graphs would correctly depict the kinetic energy versus time for the oscillating mass?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a wave curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The curve begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right, and reaches a local maximum at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, and the first tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it reaches the second tick mark on the horizontal axis. The curve then moves upward and to the right reaching another local maximum at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared and the third tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at uppercase T.

The figure shows the graph of a wave curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The curve begins at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared on the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right until it reaches the first tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, and the second tick mark on the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches the third tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, and uppercase T.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The line begins at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at uppercase T.

The figure shows the graph of a wave curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The curve begins at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared and moves gradually downward and to the right until it reaches the second tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves gradually upward and to the right until it ends at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared and uppercase T.

The figure shows the graph of a wave curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The curve begins at the origin and moves gradually upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared and the second tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves gradually downward and to the right until it ends on the vertical axis at uppercase T.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a wave curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, in seconds, and there are four equally spaced tick marks indicated. The fourth tick mark is labeled with the value uppercase T. The vertical axis is labeled K, in joules. The value one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, is indicated approximately two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The curve begins at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared on the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right until it reaches the first tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, and the second tick mark on the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it reaches the third tick mark on the horizontal axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends at one half times, lowercase k times A, squared, and uppercase T.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
